alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 12:15PM MST until September 13 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 315 PM MST /415 PM MDT/. * At 1214 PM MST /114 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little CO River Gorge Overlook, Tappan Spring and Navajo Reservation. This includes State Route 64 between mile markers 277 and 293. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Lee Canyon, Tappan Wash, Little Colorado River, Burro Canyon Wash and Cedar Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
